form.official-title: To modify the Federal Ocean Acidification Research and Monitoring Act of 2009, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Ocean Acidification Research and Monitoring Act of 2015.
Section 12402(a) of the Federal Ocean Acidification Research and Monitoring Act of 2009 (33 U.S.C. 3701(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking development and coordination and inserting coordination and implementation;
in paragraph (1)(A), by inserting ocean chemistry and after ocean acidification on;
in paragraph (1)(B), by striking establish an interagency research and monitoring and inserting maintain and advise an interagency research, monitoring, and public outreach; and
in paragraph (2), by striking establishment and inserting maintenance.

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraph (3); and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subsection:
The Chairman of the Subcommittee shall establish an Ocean Acidification Advisory Board.
The Advisory Board shall have 15 members, with a reasonable cross-sectional representation of the United States coastal, island, and Great Lakes regions, including—

subparagraph.text: 2 representatives of the shellfish and crab industry;
1 representative of the finfish industry;
1 representative of seafood processors;
3 representatives from academia, including both natural and social sciences;
1 representative of relevant nongovernmental organizations;
6 representatives from relevant State, local, and tribal governments and Federal agencies; and
1 additional qualified member.

paragraph.text: The Chairman of the Subcommittee shall appoint members to 5-year terms, giving consideration to ensuring an appropriate balance of scientific, industry, and geographical interests, and ensuring representation from all relevant sectors. A member may be appointed to more than one term.
The Chairman of the Subcommittee shall seek and give due consideration to applications from members of the public for seats on the Advisory Board.

The Chairman of the Subcommittee shall seek and give due consideration to nominations and recommendations from the public and the members of the interagency working group for the appointments to the Advisory Board.

Selection of individuals for the Advisory Board shall be based on their demonstrated expertise on ocean acidification and its scientific, economic, industry, and community impacts, and their record of distinguished service in relation to this issue. Their perspectives shall broadly represent the interest group for which the seat is designated.
The Chairman of the Subcommittee shall appoint one member of the Advisory Board to serve as Chairman.
The Advisory Board shall meet at such times and places as may be designated by the Chairman of the Advisory Board, in consultation with the Chairman of the Subcommittee.
The Advisory Board shall—

subparagraph.text: not later than 6 months after transmittal of a report by the Subcommittee under subsection (c)(2), transmit to the Subcommittee, the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives, and the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives an analysis of such report;

not later than 6 months after publication of the most recent strategic research plan under section 12405, transmit to the Subcommittee, the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate, the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology of the House of Representatives, and the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives an analysis of such strategic research plan and the implementation thereof;
provide ongoing advice to the Subcommittee and the interagency working group on matters related to Federal activities on ocean acidification taken pursuant to this subtitle;
advise the Subcommittee and the interagency working group on the content and design of the Information Exchange described in subsection (b)(6);
advise the Subcommittee and the interagency working group on the standards developed for data archiving as required under section 12406(c);
establish a publicly accessible web page, hosted by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, that includes—

clause.text: the charter required under section 9(c) of the Federal Advisory Committee Act (5 U.S.C. App.);
schedules and minutes for meetings of the Advisory Board;
any documents described in subsections (b) and (c) of section 9 of the Federal Advisory Committee Act that are created by the Advisory Board; and
any reports prepared by the Advisory Board;

subparagraph.text: publish in the Federal Register the charter described in subparagraph (F)(i); and
provide to the Library of Congress any charter or document described in subparagraph (F)(i) or (iii).

paragraph.text: The Federal Advisory Committee Act shall not apply to the Advisory Board, except for section 9(b) and (c) and section 10(a) through (d).

section.text: Section 12406 of the Federal Ocean Acidification Research and Monitoring Act of 2009 (33 U.S.C. 3705) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: by inserting coordination, after research, monitoring,;
in paragraph (1)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (B)—

subclause.text: by inserting including the Integrated Ocean Observing System and the ocean observing assets of other agencies, after ocean observing assets,; and

by inserting and agency and department missions, prioritizing co-location of monitoring instruments, assets, and projects for efficient use of resources and to optimize understanding of socioeconomic impacts and ecosystem health after research program;

clause.text: in subparagraph (C), by inserting and protecting impacted industries and communities after marine ecosystems; and
in subparagraph (F), by striking monitoring and impacts research and inserting research, monitoring, and adaptation strategies; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking projects that explore and inserting and education projects that explore and communicate; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subsection:

The Secretary, in coordination with members of the interagency working group, shall establish data processing, storage, and archive facilities and procedures to provide for the long-term stewardship of environmental data, products, and information necessary for carrying out this subtitle.
Activities under this subsection shall include—

subparagraph.text: archiving environmental data collected by Federal, State, and local agencies, academic scientists, citizen scientists, industry and tribal organizations, and federally funded research;

promoting widespread availability and dissemination of environmental data and information through full and open access exchange to the greatest extent possible, including in electronic format on the Internet through resources such as the Information Exchange described in section 12404(b)(6);

developing standards, protocols, and procedures for interoperability and intercalibration and the sharing of Federal data with State and local government programs, the private sector, and academia; and
developing metadata standards in accordance with available guidelines.

paragraph.text: Recipients of grants from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration under this subtitle shall collect data in accordance with the interoperability, intercalibration, and metadata standards described in paragraph (2) and submit those data to the Secretary on a timely basis.
